generif.text: IMP1 localization is associated with motility and the major functions of IMP1 are carried out by the phylogenetically conserved KH domains

Aberrant CRD-BP expression may interfere with c-myc regulation. Copy number gains at 8q24 (c-myc), were seen in 48.3% of tumors, gains at 17q21 (CRD-BP) in 18.3%,& CRD-BP was seen in 58.5%, implying mechanisms of activation other than gene amplification.
IMP1 translocates to the nucleus and contains nuclear export signals within the RNA-binding KH2 and KH4 domains.
IMP-1 may have a role in progression of ovarian cancer
Intestinal epithelial cells continue to express IMP1 postnatally, and Imp1(-/-) mice exhibited impaired development of the intestine, with small and misshapen villi and twisted colon crypts.
highest frequency of CRD-BP positive tumors was observed in meningiomas
intimate association of fragile X mental retardation protein and IMP1 suggests a link between mRNA transport and translational repression in mammalian cells
A cooperative mechanism for the binding of IMP-1 to RNA.
CRD-BP has a dominant role in proliferation of human K562 cells by an IGF-II-dependent mechanism independent of its ability to serve as a c-myc mRNA masking protein
normal role for CRD-BP/IMP1 in pluripotent stem cells with high renewal capacity
We have further characterized the interaction between PABP and IMP1 with the 3' end of the adenine-rich autoregulatory sequence
IMP-1 expression is likely to play important roles in lung cancer development and progression

Study isolated the IMP1-containing RNP granules and found that they represent a unique ribonucleoprotein entity distinct from neuronal hStaufen and/or fragile X mental retardation protein granules, processing bodies, and stress granules.
VICKZ exhibits differential expression in lymphoma subtypes and thus may be a marker of potential value in the diagnosis and study of hematopoietic neoplasia.
IMP1 is an oncogenic factor that is involved in promoting elevated proliferation by stabilizing the c-myc mRNA in ovarian carcinoma cells.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
IMP-1 associates with Gag protein of HIV-1 and its overexpression affects virus assembly.
Knockdown of CRD-BP inhibits NF-kappaB activity, induces apoptosis, and suppresses proliferation and tumorigenic properties of melanoma cells.
These experiments suggest that in breast cancer cells, the expression of ZBP1 and the expression of beta-catenin are coordinately regulated.
IGFBP-1, which can inhibit IGF action, also increased during in-vitro decidualization of cultured human ESCs.
These data suggest that repression of ZBP1 by blocking beta-catenin binding at the ZBP1 promoter deregulates its associated mRNAs, leading to the phenotypic changes of breast cancers.
IGF2BP1, by binding to the HCV 5'UTR and/or HCV 3'UTR, recruits eIF3 and enhances HCV IRES-mediated translation.
CRD-BP prevents degradation of betaTrCP1 mRNA by attenuating its miR-183-dependent interaction with Ago2.
expression of 8S-LOX and 15S-LOX-2 suppresses CRD-BP/IMP-1 expression, resulting in inhibition of human prostate carcinoma PC-3 cell proliferation.

IMP1 interacts with HIV1 Rev protein and its ectopic expression causes relocation of Rev from the nucleus to the cytoplasm and ectopic expression of IMP1 leads to significant accumulation of multiple spliced HIV-1 RNA.
Wnt/beta-catenin signaling induces expression of an RNA-binding protein, CRD-BP, which in turn binds and stabilizes GLI1 mRNA, causing an elevation of GLI1 expression and transcriptional activity.
Observational study and genome-wide association study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
IGF2BP1 genotype, haplotype and genetic model studies in metabolic syndrome traits and diabetes
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Observational study of gene-disease association and gene-gene interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
IMP1 plays a role in regulating the packaging of MLV genomic RNA and can be used for improving production of retroviral vectors
Studies identify a novel proapoptotic gene target, CYFIP2, which is downregulated by IMP-1, and mediates the regulation of cell survival and K-Ras expression in colon cancer cells.
Data show that the let-7 (let-7d and let-7g) target IMP-1 stabilizes the mRNA of MDR1.
sh-RNA knockdown of CRD-BP enhances the effect of dacarbazine, temozolomide, vinblastine, & etoposide on both primary and metastatic melanoma cell lines.
these data indicate that ZBP1 may function as an adapter to export the Ro/Y3 RNA complex from nuclei.
The defective splicing caused by the ISCU intron mutation in patients with myopathy with lactic acidosis is repressed by PTBP1 but can be derepressed by IGF2BP1.

The data of this study suggest that RNA-binding proteins can be used as a tool to identify the post-transcriptional regulation of gene expression in the establishment and function of neural circuits involved in addiction behaviors.
in both T47D and MDA231 human breast carcinoma cells IMP1/ZBP1 functions to suppress cell invasion
IGF2BP1 promotes the velocity and directionality of tumor-derived cell migration by determining the cytoplasmic fate of two novel target mRNAs: MAPK4 and PTEN
IGF2BP1 is a potent oncogenic factor that regulates the adhesion, migration and invasiveness of tumor cells by modulating intracellular signaling.
Shows role for CRD-BP in the regulation of melanoma cell invasion and highlights the importance of the hypoxic microenvironment in determining cell fate.
IGF2BP1 acts as an adaptor protein that recruits the CCR4-NOT complex and thereby initiates the degradation of the lncRNA HULC.
our study suggests that IMP1might play an important role in the progression of choriocarcinoma through the regulation of cell migration and invasion.
The RNA-binding protein IGF2BP1 is an important protumorigenic factor in liver carcinogenesis.

Data suggest GHET1 (gastric carcinoma high expressed transcript 1) is prognostic factor for gastric carcinoma; GHET1 promotes c-Myc (proto-oncogene proteins c-Myc) mRNA stability/expression, binds IGF2BP1, and promotes gastric carcinoma growth.
CRD-BP is overexpressed in basal cell carcinoma and its expression positively correlates with the activation of both Wnt and Hh signaling pathways
Results identify IGF2BP1 as a critical translational regulator of cIAP1-mediated apoptotic resistance in rhabdomyosarcoma.
These results indicate that IGF2BP1 and TET1/2 contribute to the stemness of MSCs, at least regarding their proliferative potential.
A 14;17 translocation resulting in an IGH-IGF2BP1 fusion is associated with B acute lymphoblastic leukemia.
Two KH domains of CRD-BP are required for efficient binding to oncogenic mRNAs and for granule formation in zebrafish embryos.
MicroRNA-340-mediated degradation of MITF mRNA is inhibited by CRD-BP.
miR-873 negatively affected the carcinogenesis and metastasis of GBM by down-regulating the expression of IGF2BP1, which stabilizes the mRNA transcripts of its target genes
Data demonstrate that IGF2BP1 is a potential oncogene and an independent negative prognostic factor in neuroblastoma.
High CRD-BP expression is associated with Breast Tumor.
IGF2BP1 as a direct and functional target of miR-196b.
Data show that insulin-like growth factor-2-mRNA-binding proteins IGF2BP1, IGF2BP2, and IGF2BP3 are direct targets of microRNA-1275 (miR-1275).
The tumor-suppressive role of stromal IMP1 and its ability to modulate protumorigenic factors suggest that IMP1 status is important for the initiation and growth of epithelial tumors
Data show that ONECUT2, IGF2BP1, and ANXA2 proteins were confirmed to be microRNA-9 (miR-9) targets and aberrantly upregulated in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
ETV6/RUNX1 transcript is a target of RNA-binding protein IGF2BP1 in t(12;21)(p13;q22)-positive acute lymphoblastic leukemia.
Our studies provide insights into a molecular mechanism that the positive function of IMP1 to inhibit breast tumor growth and metastasis
The findings indicate that the tumor-suppressive roles of the let-7 family are antagonized by a potent and self-promoting triangle consisting of IGF2BP1 (potentially all IGF2BPs), LIN28B and HMGA2.
The results from this study demonstrate the potential importance of the two-stem-loop motif as a target region for the inhibition of the CRD-BP-GLI1 RNA interaction and Hedgehog signaling pathway.
IGF2BP1 indirectly potentiates ETV6/RUNX1-RAC1-STAT3 signaling axis by sustaining appropriate ETV6/RUNX1 and STAT3 transcript levels in REH cells.

Findings suggest a MicroRNA-140-5p (miR-140-5p)-Insulin like growth factor 2 mRNA binding protein 1 (IGF2BP1) regulatory circuit for CC pathogenesis, and miR-140-5p may be a potential target for CC therapy.
Insight into molecular interactions between CRD-BP and MITF mRNA.
miR-98-5p, downregulated in HCC, inhibits proliferation while inducing apoptosis in HCC LM3 cells, partly at least, through directly targeting IGF2BP1

The regions encoding 71 microRNAs (miRs) were deleted in at least 25% of tumor specimens. Five of these recurrently deleted miRs targeted the insulin-like growth factor 2 mRNA-binding protein 1 (IGF2BP1) gene product, and a correlating 100-fold upregulation of IGF2BP1 mRNA was seen in tumor specimens
report insulin-like growth factor-II binding protein 1 (IGF2BP1) as a novel interacting partner of p38 MAPK.
IGF2BP1 mediates posttranscriptional loss of BCL11A in cultured human adult erythroblasts
HCG11 exerted its effect on Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC)via interaction with IGF2BP1, leading to activation of MAPK signaling, which eventually promoted the progression of HCC
SOX12 can increase the expression of CDK4 and IGF2BP1, which confer malignant phenotypes to Hepatocellular Carcinoma.

Results demonstrate that IGF2BP1 plays an important role in the sensitivity of melanoma to targeted therapy. Inhibition of IGF2BP1 enhances the effects of BRAF-inhibitor and BRAF-MEK inhibitors in BRAF(V600E) melanoma. Also, knockdown of IGF2BP1 alone is sufficient to reduce tumorigenic characteristics in vemurafenib-resistant melanoma.
IMP1 shows alternating binding in nanocores and anomalous diffusion in the liquid phase of stress granules.
The direct binding of IGF2BPs to RNA N(6)-methyladenosine through their KH domains enhances mRNA stability and translation.

Our study provides initial evidence that interaction between IMP1 and UCA1 enhances UCA1 decay and competes for miR-122-5p binding, leading to the liberation of miR-122-5p activity and the reduction of cell invasiveness.
IGF2BP1 is essential for human skin squamous cell carcinoma cell survival and proliferation.
The present study shows that the regulation of KRAS expression by IMP1 is complex and may involve both the IMP1 protein and its mRNA transcript.

lncRNA THOR is up-regulated in retinoblastoma, and its over-expression significantly enhances the malignant phenotype transformation of retinoblastoma cells by up-regulating c-myc and TGF2BP1 expression.
our data suggest that miR-150 and its downstream target IGF2BP1 may be a crucial axis for the development, progression and patients' prognosis of ostesarcoma

Results found that IGF2BP1 was significantly activated in lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) patients. Also, the expression of IGF2BP1 was significantly higher in LUAD patients with LIN28B-AS1 activation than other patients. LIN28B-AS1 alters the LIN28B mRNA stability by directly interacting with IGF2BP1.

35 SRF/IGF2BP1-dependent genes showing conserved association with SRF and IGF2BP1 expression indicate a poor overall survival probability in ovarian, liver and lung cancer. In conclusion, these findings identify the SRF/IGF2BP1-, miRNome- and m6A-dependent control of gene expression as a conserved oncogenic driver network in cancer.
IMP1 3' UTR shortening is associated with enhanced metastatic burden in colorectal cancer.
PKCalpha is upregulated by IMP1 in melanoma and may have a role in worse survival

Results show that p62 binds to IGF2BP1 to control the mRNA stability of FERMT2 and multiple pro-metastatic factors. This p62-RBP interaction distinguishes melanoma from other tumors where p62 controls autophagy or oxidative stress.

MiR-423-5p inhibited migration, invasion, and proliferation as well as induced apoptosis, by targeting IGF2BP1 trophoblasts, presenting a novel molecular basis implicated in pre-eclampsia pathogenesis.
Induced miR-222 represses expression of ZBP1 and PLCgamma1 at the posttranscriptional level.

LINC01093 directly binds insulin-like growth factor 2 mRNA-binding protein 1 (IGF2BP1), interfering with interaction between IGF2BP1 and glioma-associated oncogene homolog 1 (GLI1) mRNA. The result is degradation of GLI1 mRNA, further affecting expression of GLI1 downstream molecules involved in HCC progression.
IMP1 KH1 and KH2 domains create a structural platform with unique RNA recognition and re-modelling properties.
The role of RNA-binding protein IGF2BP1 in EV-mediated promotion of melanoma metastasis.
miR-4500 inhibits human glioma cell progression by targeting IGF2BP1.
IGF2BP1 promotes lipopolysaccharide-induced NFkappaB signalling and transcriptional activation in human macrophages and monocytes.
The present study defines a novel interplay between IMP1 and autophagy, where IMP1 may be transiently induced during damage to modulate colonic epithelial cell responses to damage.
We demonstrate that low IGF2BP1 and FOXM1 expression can serve as a potential factor for the clinical diagnosis and prognosis of lung adenocarcinoma
THOR mediated IGF2 expression via interacting with IGF2BP1, and affected the downstream MEK-ERK signaling pathway to regulate tongue squamous cell carcinomas cells proliferation.
The LIN28B-AS1, binding to IGF2BP1, is required for LPS-induced NFkappaB activation and pro-inflammatory responses in human macrophages.
The interaction between IGF2BP1 and DHAV-1 3' UTR strongly enhanced IRES-mediated translation efficiency but failed to regulate DHAV-1 replication in a duck embryo epithelial (DEE) cell line.

Study found that IGF2BP1 was upregulated and associated with a poor prognosis in pancreatic cancer patients. Downregulation of IGF2BP1 inhibited pancreatic cancer cell growth in vitro and in vivo via the AKT signaling pathway. Upregulation of IGF2BP1 was attributed to the downregulation of miR-494 expression in pancreatic cancer and reexpression of miR-494 could partially abrogate the oncogenic role of IGF2BP1.

Data for the leukaemia risk loci BCL2-antagonist-killer 1 protein (BAK1) and insulin like growth factor 2 mRNA binding protein 1 (IGF2BP1) suggests deregulation of B-cell development and genetic susceptibility to precursor B-cell lymphoblastic leukemia (Pre B-ALL) [Meta-Analysis].
RNA-binding protein IGF2BP1 maintains leukemia stem cell properties by regulating HOXB4, MYB, and ALDH1A1.
Exome sequencing revealed DNA variants in NCOR1, IGF2BP1, SGLT2 and NEK11 as potential novel causes of ketotic hypoglycemia in children.
Interaction analysis of miR-1275/IGF2BP1/IGF2BP3 with the susceptibility to hepatocellular carcinoma.

LncRNA LINC00266-1 encodes a 71-amino acid peptide that mainly interacts with the RNA-binding proteins and is thus named "RNA-binding regulatory peptide" (RBRP). RBRP binds to IGF2BP1 and strengthens m6A recognition by IGF2BP1 on RNAs, such as c-Myc mRNA, to increase the mRNA stability and expression of c-Myc, thereby promoting tumorigenesis. Cancer patients with RBRPhigh have a poor prognosis.
LINC01426 contributes to clear cell renal cell carcinoma progression by modulating CTBP1/miR-423-5p/FOXM1 axis via interacting with IGF2BP1.
Initiation of stress granule assembly by rapid clustering of IGF2BP proteins upon osmotic shock.
IGF2BP1 is the first positive marker for anaplastic thyroid carcinoma diagnosis.
The oncofetal RNA-binding protein IGF2BP1 is a druggable, post-transcriptional super-enhancer of E2F-driven gene expression in cancer.
TRIM71 binds to IMP1 and is capable of positive and negative regulation of target RNAs.
IGF2BP1 is a targetable SRC/MAPK-dependent driver of invasive growth in ovarian cancer.
LIN28B-AS1-IGF2BP1 binding promotes hepatocellular carcinoma cell progression.

Anti-oncogene PTPN13 inactivation by hepatitis B virus X protein counteracts IGF2BP1 to promote hepatocellular carcinoma progression.
miR-885-5p inhibits proliferation and metastasis by targeting IGF2BP1 and GALNT3 in human intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.
A novel circular RNA, circXPO1, promotes lung adenocarcinoma progression by interacting with IGF2BP1.
circBICD2 targets miR-149-5p/IGF2BP1 axis to regulate oral squamous cell carcinoma progression.
Long noncoding RNA NBAT1 suppresses hepatocellular carcinoma progression via competitively associating with IGF2BP1 and decreasing c-Myc expression.
LncRNA LINC00689 Promotes the Tumorigenesis of Glioma via Mediation of miR-526b-3p/IGF2BP1 Axis.
IGF2BP1 overexpression stabilizes PEG10 mRNA in an m6A-dependent manner and promotes endometrial cancer progression.
Genetic variants in m(6)A regulators are associated with gastric cancer risk.
circNDUFB2 inhibits non-small cell lung cancer progression via destabilizing IGF2BPs and activating anti-tumor immunity.
METTL3/IGF2BP1/CD47 contributes to the sublethal heat treatment induced mesenchymal transition in HCC.
LINC00483 is regulated by IGF2BP1 and participates in the progression of breast cancer.
Carboxymethylated chitosan alleviated oxidative stress injury in retinal ganglion cells via IncRNA-THOR/IGF2BP1 axis.
CircPTPRA blocks the recognition of RNA N(6)-methyladenosine through interacting with IGF2BP1 to suppress bladder cancer progression.
The pan-cancer analysis of the two types of uterine cancer uncovered clinical and prognostic associations with m6A RNA methylation regulators.
IGF2BP1/UHRF2 Axis Mediated by miR-98-5p to Promote the Proliferation of and Inhibit the Apoptosis of Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
Development and validation of m6A regulators' prognostic significance for endometrial cancer.
An oncogenic lncRNA, GLCC1, promotes tumorigenesis in gastric carcinoma by enhancing the c-Myc/IGF2BP1 interaction.
EGR2-mediated regulation of m(6)A reader IGF2BP proteins drive RCC tumorigenesis and metastasis via enhancing S1PR3 mRNA stabilization.
Involvement of m6A regulatory factor IGF2BP1 in malignant transformation of human bronchial epithelial Beas-2B cells induced by tobacco carcinogen NNK.
IGF2BP1-regulated expression of ERRalpha is involved in metabolic reprogramming of chemotherapy resistant osteosarcoma cells.
Regulation of IGF2BP1 by miR-186 and its impact on downstream lncRNAs H19, FOXD2-AS1, and SNHG3 in HCC.
Feedforward loop between IMP1 and YAP/TAZ promotes tumorigenesis and malignant progression in glioblastoma.
WTAP-mediated m6A modification on circCMTM3 inhibits hepatocellular carcinoma ferroptosis by recruiting IGF2BP1 to increase PARK7 stability.
Stabilization of IGF2BP1 by USP10 promotes breast cancer metastasis via CPT1A in an m6A-dependent manner.
EMX2OS targeting IGF2BP1 represses Wilms' tumour stemness,epithelial-mesenchymal transition and metastasis.
IGF2BP1-mediated N6-methyladenosine modification promotes intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma progression.
CDCA4 interacts with IGF2BP1 to regulate lung adenocarcinoma proliferation via the PI3K/AKT pathway.
LINC00858 facilitates formation of hepatic metastases from colorectal cancer via regulating the miR-132-3p/IGF2BP1 axis.
PRMT3-mediated arginine methylation of IGF2BP1 promotes oxaliplatin resistance in liver cancer.
A desert lncRNA HIDEN regulates human endoderm differentiation via interacting with IMP1 and stabilizing FZD5 mRNA.
IGF2BP1 induces neuroblastoma via a druggable feedforward loop with MYCN promoting 17q oncogene expression.
RPS15 interacted with IGF2BP1 to promote esophageal squamous cell carcinoma development via recognizing m[6]A modification.
IGF2BP1-An Oncofetal RNA-Binding Protein Fuels Tumor Virus Propagation.
N6-methyladenosine reader protein IGF2BP1 suppresses CD8 + T cells-mediated tumor cytotoxicity and apoptosis in colon cancer.
m[6]A modification of AC026356.1 facilitates hepatocellular carcinoma progression by regulating the IGF2BP1-IL11 axis.
CRD-BP as a Tumor Marker of Colorectal Cancer.
Long non-coding RNA linc00659 promotes tumour progression by regulating FZD6/Wnt/beta-catenin signalling pathway in colorectal cancer via m6A reader IGF2BP1.
TRIM29 promotes antitumor immunity through enhancing IGF2BP1 ubiquitination and subsequent PD-L1 downregulation in gastric cancer.
LncRNA linc01194 promotes the progress of endometrial carcinoma by up-regulating SOX2 through binding to IGF2BP1.
CircMAPK1 promoted CD8 + T cell infiltration in LUAD by improving the IGF2BP1 dependent CCL5 upregulation.
IGF2BP1 facilitates non-small cell lung cancer progression by regulating the KIF2A-mediated Wnt/beta-catenin pathway.
Tumor suppressive function of IGF2BP1 in gastric cancer through decreasing MYC.
CircSTRBP contributes to H2O2-induced lens epithelium cell dysfunction through increasing NOX4 mRNA stability by recruiting IGF2BP1.
METTL3 Promotes Osteogenic Differentiation of Human Periodontal Ligament Stem Cells through IGF2BP1-Mediated Regulation of Runx2 Stability.
m 6 A reader IGF2BP1 reduces the sensitivity of nasopharyngeal carcinoma cells to Taxol by upregulation of AKT2.
Inhibition of IGF2BP1 attenuates the progression of endometriosis through PTBP1.
A Mettl16/m[6]A/mybl2b/Igf2bp1 axis ensures cell cycle progression of embryonic hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells.
m6a methylation orchestrates IMP1 regulation of microtubules during human neuronal differentiation.

BP.term: regulation of mRNA stability involved in response to stress
negative regulation of nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, deadenylation-dependent decay

name: insulin like growth factor 2 mRNA binding protein 1
other_names: insulin-like growth factor 2 mRNA binding protein 1 deltaN CRDBP

pid.name: Regulation of nuclear beta catenin signaling and target gene transcription

reactome.name: Insulin-like Growth Factor-2 mRNA Binding Proteins (IGF2BPs/IMPs/VICKZs) bind RNA

wikipathways.name: eIF5A regulation in response to inhibition of the nuclear export system

summary: This gene encodes a member of the insulin-like growth factor 2 mRNA-binding protein family. The protein encoded by this gene contains four K homology domains and two RNA recognition motifs. It functions by binding to the mRNAs of certain genes, including insulin-like growth factor 2, beta-actin and beta-transducin repeat-containing protein, and regulating their translation. Two transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, May 2009].
